questions.question: Welcome
questions.help: You will follow moving boxes with your hands, with the hands changing. It takes about 30 minutes. Your participation is voluntary and you are free to stop at any time.We will ask you some information about yourself, including your skin tone. We will also ask you to rate your experience of the hands. We also record your movement. No personal data is collected and everything is handled anonymously. By clicking “I agree” below, you acknowledge that you have read this information, voluntarily participate in this study, and allow us to store and analyze your data from this study. Do you consent to participate in the study?

questions.question: Introduction
questions.help: Your task in this study is to follow the movement of boxes appearing in front of you. Keep your hands inside the boxes as they move. Green indicates you are inside; red indicates you are not. You can do this task standing up or sitting down, but please don’t switch between the two. Make sure you have space in front of you. You will see a countdown before the first box appears. Halfway through a trial, the first box fades out and a second one appears. Please switch hands at that point. You now have the chance to try the task.
Pick the most accurate reaction of your skin to sun exposure:
questions.question: Self-assess your skin tone
questions.b1:
I.
Highly sensitive, always burns, never tans.
questions.b2:
II.
Very sun sensitive, burns easily, tans minimally.
questions.b3:
III.
Sun sensitive skin, sometimes burns, slowly tans to light brown.
questions.b4:
IV.
Minimally sun sensitive, burns minimally, always tans to moderate brown.
questions.b5:
V.
Sun insensitive skin, rarely burns, tans well.
questions.b6:
VI.
Sun insensitive, never burns, deeply pigmented.

questions.question: Ready?
questions.help: Great. Looks like you got the hang of it. You can now move on to the main study.
I felt that my virtual hands resembled my own (real) hands in terms of shape, skin tone, or other visual features
I felt that the movements of the virtual hands were caused by my own movements
I felt that the virtual hands I saw were my own hands
